channel.title: Jar to .Exe? (Anti leeching?)
channel.description:
Hi
I am making a server with load of custom items, weapons and stuff. But i don't want my models to be leeched. Is it possible to convert .jar to .exe and add it into a html like a webclient? A normal webclient but that uses an exe file instead of a .jar?

item.title: Jar to .Exe? (Anti leeching?)
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

protip changing something as simple as a value in stringToInt() method would throw off anyone for quite some time.

Read full topic

If you are clever enough
[/quote]how does that require the minute sense of cleverness[/quote]
psst, this is moparscape.

item.title: Jar to .Exe? (Anti leeching?)
item.dc:creator: @The_Arcanian The Arcanian
item.description:
@The_Arcanian wrote:

Ehh, ok thanx everyone for the help.
Well i think it wont take longer than 10 years for me and my java skills to do that…

Read full topic

item.title: Jar to .Exe? (Anti leeching?)
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

If you are clever enough and analyse how the cache is packed/unpacked you could modify this algorithm, repack the cache and then obfuscate(unfortunately you have to torrent an obfuscator) the class containing the unpacker.

This is all hardcore stuff. Although if you don’t want ANYONE to steal the models in the cache you need to do this.

Read full topic

item.title: Jar to .Exe? (Anti leeching?)
item.dc:creator: @wolfs_goal wolfs goal
item.description:
@wolfs_goal wrote:

[quote=“The Arcanian, post:1, topic:323807”]Hi

I am making a server with load of custom items, weapons and stuff. But i don’t want my models to be leeched. Is it possible to convert .jar to .exe and add it into a html like a webclient?
A normal webclient but that uses an exe file instead of a .jar?[/quote]

After you compile the client after adding models.

You can delete the models folder. It packs the models into the cache automatically, or at least thats what my client does…

Read full topic

item.title: Jar to .Exe? (Anti leeching?)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:5, topic:323807”]ps gay applications like jar2exe simply create a java vm and call JNI’s DefineClass() function to define each class in the jar

if you would really like the jar to be compiled to native, you can always look for a good, functional aot java compiler. but then again, this would be defeating java’s main strength, which is being portable

just obfuscate it. and as for the cache, do as lin says and modify the format[/quote]

Only about 10% of Mopars population (if even that) knows how to modify the formats of the cache.

Read full topic

item.title: Jar to .Exe? (Anti leeching?)
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

ps gay applications like jar2exe simply create a java vm and call JNI’s DefineClass() function to define each class in the jar

if you would really like the jar to be compiled to native, you can always look for a good, functional aot java compiler. but then again, this would be defeating java’s main strength, which is being portable

just obfuscate it. and as for the cache, do as lin says and modify the format

Read full topic

item.title: Jar to .Exe? (Anti leeching?)
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Just as a side note, once you add custom models into your cache, you can delete the files as it packs them. As for anti-leech, you could always change the cache format

Read full topic

item.title: Jar to .Exe? (Anti leeching?)
item.dc:creator: @The_Arcanian The Arcanian
item.description:
@The_Arcanian wrote:

CoonHunter:

The way for it not to be leeched, is for them to be in your cache, but if they are crafty like, Graffle, or Me, we both have tools that can rip apart any cache, new or old, to get stuff. Truely, there is no 100% anti-leech, expecially for models.

ehh…

thanx

Read full topic

item.title: Jar to .Exe? (Anti leeching?)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

The way for it not to be leeched, is for them to be in your cache, but if they are crafty like, Graffle, or Me, we both have tools that can rip apart any cache, new or old, to get stuff. Truely, there is no 100% anti-leech, expecially for models.

Read full topic
